attributes.action: Create a publicly accessable source of all CURRENT legislation
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Ignorance of the law is not a defence. So why isn't there a government website which will tell you what the CURRENT rules and regulations in this country are?

The HMSO website contains legislation AS PUBLISHED, so once you’ve found the original text, you must go through the laborious and technically difficult process of amending by hand. This assumes you can find all of the amendments in the first place.

Where OUR legislation refers to EU legislation, or British Standards, those texts should also be freely available. It’s no good saying number plates must conform to BS AU145d, if it then costs £36 to find out what that standard is, for example.

The government makes the laws, so it should be in a position to clearly inform people what they are.

Please be open about what our laws are by publishing our current legislation. [A facility to check the current legislation as of any given date would also be useful.] This system would be more useful than the AS PUBLISHED texts. It would allow the ordinary person, and practitioners, to read the laws he is expected to abide by. He can seek legal advice if he doesn't understand it, but at least he has a fighting chance.
